uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools
Class CircleLayer

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.SimpleLayer
        |
        +--uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.ShapeLayer
              |
              +--uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.CircleLayer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Layer, LockableSize
Direct Known Subclasses:
CartogramLayer
public class CircleLayer
extends ShapeLayer
implements Layer, LockableSize

A layer for containing a feature set of GeoCircles Circle Layer now extends ShapeLayer which now does a lot of the common work for layers

Version:
0.7.0, 9 Dec 1999
Author:
James Macgill

paintScaled

public void paintScaled(GeoGraphics gg)
Paints a scaled version of the layer to the given graphics contex.
Generaly only called by a theme that contains this layer.
Specified by:
paintScaled in interface Layer
Parameters:
gg - A GeoGraphics containing all of the info needed to paint this layer to screen

getID

public int getID(GeoPoint p,
                 Scaler s)
Find the feature that contains this point. Note This method will return the first feature found to contain the point only, even if multiple, overlapping features, contain the same point.
Specified by:
getID in interface LockableSize
Parameters:
point - The GeoPoint to test each feature against.
Returns:
int The ID of the first feature to contain this point, -1 if no feature was found

                           Scaler scale,
                           int id,
                           ShadeStyle style)
Scales and plots a highlighted version of one of the polygons
Specified by:
paintHighlight in interface Layer
Following copied from interface: uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.Layer
Parameters:
g - A Graphics object to paint the highlighted feature to.
scale - A scaler that can be used to scale the feature.
id - An int for the ID of the feature to be highlighted.
style - A style with hints on how to display the highlight
See Also:

countCircles

Deprecated. use countFeatures from super class instead

public java.util.Vector getGeoCircles()
Deprecated. use the getFeatures method from ShapeLayer instead
